org.itemscript.core.values
Interface JsonContainer

All Superinterfaces:
HasSystem, JsonGetAccess, JsonValue
All Known Subinterfaces:
JsonArray, JsonObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
ItemscriptContainer, OverlayObject, WeakArray, WeakContainer, WeakObject
public interface JsonContainer
extends JsonValue, JsonGetAccess

The parent interface for JsonObject and JsonArray. Defines a set of common operations for accessing child values of these container types.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

containsKey

boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
Tests whether this container contains a value under the given key.

Parameters:
key - The key to test.
Returns:
True if this container has a value under the key, false otherwise.

createArray

JsonArray createArray(java.lang.String key)
Create a new JsonArray in this container.

Parameters:
key - The key to create under.
Returns:
The new JsonArray.

createObject

JsonObject createObject(java.lang.String key)
Create a new JsonObject in this container.

Parameters:
key - The key to create under.
Returns:
The new JsonObject.

getByPath

JsonValue getByPath(java.lang.String path)
Get a specific value from this container using a path consisting of a series of URL-encoded keys separated by slashes. If the path is empty, it is an error.

Parameters:
path - The path to the value.
Returns:
The value under that path, or null if the value cannot be found.
Throws:
ItemscriptError - If a value that needed to be a container to interpret the path was a scalar value, or if a string key needs to be applied to an array container, or if the path was null or empty.

getOrCreateArray

JsonArray getOrCreateArray(java.lang.String key)
Get a JsonArray from this container, creating it if the value did not exist. If the value already existed but was not an array, an error will be thrown.

Parameters:
key - The key to retrieve from or create under.
Returns:
The existing or newly-created JsonArray.

getOrCreateObject

JsonObject getOrCreateObject(java.lang.String key)
Get a JsonObject from this container, creating it if the value did not exist. If the value already existed but was not an object, an error will be thrown.

Parameters:
key - The key to retrieve from or create under.
Returns:
The existing or newly-created JsonObject.

getRequiredArray

JsonArray getRequiredArray(java.lang.String key)
Get a JsonArray from this container. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonArray, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The JsonArray under that key.

getRequiredBinary

byte[] getRequiredBinary(java.lang.String key)
Get a binary value from this container as a byte[]. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonString, or is a JsonString but cannot be parsed as a base64 value, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The binary value of the JsonString under that key.

getRequiredBoolean

java.lang.Boolean getRequiredBoolean(java.lang.String key)
Get a Boolean from this container. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonBoolean, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The Boolean value of the JsonBoolean under that key.

Get a Double from this container. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonNumber, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The Double value of the JsonNumber under that key.

getRequiredInt

java.lang.Integer getRequiredInt(java.lang.String key)
Get an Integer from this container. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonNumber, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The Integer value of the JsonNumber under that key.

getRequiredLong

java.lang.Long getRequiredLong(java.lang.String key)
Get a Long from this container. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonString, throws an exception. If the value is a JsonString, but it cannot be converted to a Long value, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The Long value of the JsonString under that key.

JsonObject getRequiredObject(java.lang.String key)
Get a JsonObject from this container. If the value does not exist, or is not a JsonObject, throws an exception.

Parameters:
key - The key to get from.
Returns:
The JsonObject value under that key.

put

JsonBoolean put(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Boolean value)

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The boolean value to store.
Returns:
A new JsonBoolean.

put

JsonString put(java.lang.String key,
               byte[] value)
Put a binary value. The value will be base64-encoded and stored in a JsonString.

Note: The JsonString object will point to the underlying byte[] that was supplied; it will not copy it. The internal operations of the JsonSystem will not change it, but it will be made directly available through the JsonString object's JsonValue.binaryValue() method. So, if you need to make sure that the original is not changed, you must copy it before supplying it to this method.

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The binary value to store.
Returns:
A new JsonString.

JsonNumber put(java.lang.String key,
               java.lang.Double value)

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The double value to store.
Returns:

putByPath

void putByPath(java.lang.String path,
               JsonValue value)
Put a value in this container or one of its sub-elements using a path consisting of a series of URL-encoded keys separated by slashes. If the path is empty, it is an error.

Parameters:
path - The path to the new value.
value - The value to put.
Throws:
ItemscriptError - If a value that needed to be a container to interpret the path was a scalar value, or if a string key needs to be applied to an array container, or if the path was null or empty.

putNative

JsonNative putNative(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.Object value)
Put a native object as a JsonNative.

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The native object to store.
Returns:
A new JsonNative.

putValue

void putValue(java.lang.String key,
              JsonValue value)
Put a JsonValue. Note that the JsonValue to be stored must not currently be inside another container; nor can it be the parent of this container (so cycles are not allowed). Nor can it be the value of another JsonItem.

Parameters:
key - The key to put the value under.
value - The JsonValue to store.

removeValue

void removeValue(java.lang.String key)
Remove a value from this container by key.

Parameters:
key - The key to remove.

removeByPath

void removeByPath(java.lang.String path)
Remove a value from this container by path.

Parameters:
path - The path to the value to remove.
Throws:
ItemscriptError - If a value that needed to be a container to interpret the path was a scalar value, or if a string key needs to be applied to an array container, or if the path was null or empty.

size

int size()
Get the number of entries in this container.

Returns:
The number of entries in this container.
